post: Thrilled and grateful for the support from Jeremy Dobos and his company Master Printing and Mailing for donating over 1,000 calendars for teachers around the country. He has a made a HUGE difference as part of Bill of Rights Institute Power of the Printed Word. Jeremy is also a veteran who served his country with honor. If you need any printing, please consider them! www.masterprinting.ink  #civics  #education  #students  #teachers

Are you a student looking to make an impact in your local community? Show us your impact for a chance to win up to $10,000 in student prizes. To participate, you must create a contest login, have an active civic engagement or service-based project, and submit an essay detailing how the project furthers a BRI Civic Virtue or Founding Principle, a complete a report describing how the project works, photographic or visual documentation of the project. To learn more, visit  https://lnkd.in/gagj58zD

With the upcoming election, both students and educators may feel heightened levels of stress and anxiety. Weve partnered with the Bill of Rights Institute, offering free resources, to equip teachers with tools to navigate conversations around the election and help students manage stress during this time. View our free resources at  https://lnkd.in/giAgiwV8 Help your students manage stress by encouraging mindfulness, breathing, and promoting a sense of calm in the classroom.

You're Invited! 2024 marks the 25th anniversary of the Bill of Rights Institute. Join us for a cocktail reception on December 5, 2024, from 6-8pm! With words from BRI President and CEO, David Bobb, Vice President of Development, Anthony Simone, and Vice President of Civic Leadership Development, Gerald Gangaram. RSVP Here:  https://lnkd.in/eJ3KPi7a

Calling all students! The Bill of Rights Institute Student Fellowship for the 2024-2025 school year is now open! Submit your application by 11/10/2024. BRI's Student Fellowship program is a leadership development program. Fellows participate in robust programming during the school year and participate in a culminating week of programming in and around Philadelphia, PA and Washington, DC. To apply, visit  https://lnkd.in/e8_JueBZ  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #StudentFellowship

We would like to thank The John Roberts Company and Graphic Finishing Services, Inc. for their generous donation to the Bill of Rights Institute. Now, thousands of students in Minnesota will have their own pocket constitutions. John Roberts is a commercial printing and marketing services provider that helps companies communicate easier and more powerfully with their target audience. Graphic Finishing Services is a full-service bookbinder offering book-binding services to customers in Minneapolis-St. Paul, MN, and the Upper Midwest. To learn more about them, here  https://lnkd.in/eK6jcJau To learn how you can support Power of the Printed Word, visit  https://lnkd.in/eK6jcJau  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #PowerofthePrintedWord

It's National Estate Planning Awareness Week! Todays students rely on the Bill of Rights Institute  but tomorrows students will need us, too. Have you thought about leaving a lasting legacy with BRI? Interested in learning more? Download our free estate planning guide, here  https://lnkd.in/eZv8AdRF. This guide will help you as you begin planning for your future. It will help you consider using your estate plan to provide for your loved ones and support the causes you care about. P. S. If you have already included BRI in your estate plans, please let us know so we can thank you for your generosity. Please contact Jennifer Seal, Director of Strategic Partnerships.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #estateplanning

Its been 25 years of educating for self-governance at the Bill of Rights Institute. To help commemorate our milestone and the principles and virtues we teach every day, were excited to announce our 2025 Celebrating History Calendar! You still have time to support our mission by reserving your calendar today. Don't miss out! For a donation of $25 or more, you will receive a calendar that teaches and reflects on the people and moments that have shaped American history. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eJtYG4_S.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #calendar

As election season approaches, it can be an exciting opportunity for civic education, but it can also bring stress and anxiety, especially for students engaging in political discussions for the first time. The Bill of Rights Institute has partnered with Huddle Up, an expert in IEP therapy, SEL, and K-12 mental health services, to provide free downloadable resources, including regulation cards, breathing visuals, and break cards that educators can share with students navigating election stress. To access and download Huddle Up's free resources for managing election stress, visit  https://lnkd.in/e94EbExS  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #election

GIVE HAPPY so students across the country can continue to receive a quality civic education through the Bill of Rights Institute. Are you a Federal employee or retiree? Then GIVE HAPPY to the Bill of Rights Institute through the Combined Federal Campaign using charity code 36265. One of the great benefits of the CFC is that you can give through payroll deduction or your retiree annuity, giving a little each pay period and supporting BRI's mission all year long. Visit  https://lnkd.in/gqJpMgr and GIVE HAPPY using charity code 36265  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #GiveCFC
